response: *British novelist Robert Goddard's novel Name to a Face (2007) discusses the theories and circumstances of Edward II's survival.  Within a fictionalized setting, it is speculated that an older Edward II may be the identity of a semi-legendary medieval figure known as the Grey Man of Ennor, who traveled England mysteriously curing sufferers of the Black Death in the mid-14th century.
